summary: The Jobs in the Woods Act (S. 1336) mandates the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a grant program focused on forestry workforce development in eligible areas. These areas are non-metropolitan, low-income communities with specific broadband requirements and populations under 20,000.  Grants will be awarded to eligible entities like nonprofits and educational institutions for career pathway training programs related to forestry operations. Grant amounts range from $500,000 to $2,000,000, lasting up to 4 years. The bill authorizes $10 million in appropriations annually from 2025 to 2029.
